programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: The assassination of a seemingly ordinary Brooklyn plumber launches the team into a globe-spanning investigation that ruffles feathers with the CIA; Tiffany struggles with fieldwork in the aftermath of the Hakim case.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: The team is on the case when a suburban couple is murdered; all forensic evidence points to the home's previous owner, who is currently serving 10 years in federal prison; OA reunites with an old military colleague; Scola welcomes a new partner.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After a series of targeted bombings in Queens, the team fears a citywide gang war is imminent; until a tip from OA's old Army buddy, Clay, directs their attention to an unexpected and powerful foe; Scola continues to struggle to find a new partner.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When the sister of FBI Behavioral Analysis Unit profiler Sydney Ortiz is the victim of an attempted kidnapping and sexual assault, Sydney seeks help from Isobel and the team in tracking down a meticulous serial offender who leaves no evidence behind.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When a chaotic campus protest turns deadly, the team is called in to help quell the mayhem and track down the murderer; Jubal is concerned when Tyler is detained along with a group of student protesters.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: The team is called in to track down a serial killer after the bodies of multiple women with the same physical description are found scattered across the city; Maggie juggles her roles as a guardian to Ella and an FBI agent.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After a park ranger is shot dead by a masked assailant on Governors Island, the team discovers a string of connected crimes that leads them to their toughest roadblock yet: an online conspiracy theory community.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After three customs officers are shot dead in a cargo heist, the team entrusts OA's old army buddy Clay to help determine if it was an inside job.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: The investigation into an assistant U.S. attorney's death leads the team to a related airline whistleblower scandal; they discover that they don't have much time to thwart terrorists from crashing numerous in-flight commercial airplanes.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: Jubal's longtime confidential informant brings intel of an impending large-scale terror attack to the team, but when the details don't add up, Jubal must sift out the truth from a man who's known him at his worst.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When a gunman opens fire at a homeless shelter, the team is led toward a killer with connections to a Mexican cartel.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When the team's sex trafficking sting operation goes sideways, they race to recover a victim; Maggie makes a connection with a 911 operator to help find the girl before she is whisked out of the city or worse.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After two jurors for a high-profile mafia trial are gunned down, the team jumps into an organized crime investigation; Scola learns that one of his former drill instructors from the military academy he attended may be linked.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After two jurors for a high-profile mafia trial are gunned down, the team jumps into an organized crime investigation until it is discovered that the jurors may not have been the intended targets at all.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: As Maggie and the team search for New York's latest serial killer, the copycat method used by the murderer forces Maggie to seek help from Ray Distefano, the serial slasher she put behind bars.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Ian, the owner of the small popular local beach bar Tropical Heat, and a close personal friend of Nick's, convinces Nick to help a pretty woman with amnesia who he just met. The more they find out about her past, the less she wants to remember.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick Slaughter, a disgraced former Canadian Mountie, and DEA Agent moves to the tropical island paradise of Key Mariah. Once there he starts his own Private Detective Agency, and meets Sylvie Gerard, a local travel agent. Together they form a strong friendship and quite the detective team. However, the local police squad never make it easy for them luckily they have plenty of friends to help along the way. The Town of Key Mariah will never be the same again thanks to Nick Slaughter and company!

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A strange woman hires Nick to stop her husband, who she believes is trying to murder her. However, Nick's investigation reveals evidence that leads him to believe she might be more psychotic than paranoid.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick's partner from his DEA days arrives in Key Mariah, with a small time criminal who can help bring down a drug lord who has recently opened his operations in Key Mariah. Complicating matters is Nick's old boss has arrived in Key Mariah & for some reason keeps trying to shut down the investigation.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Alligators mouth is filled with 80 teeth and can chomp down with 2000 pounds of force. Plus mountain goats unique hoofs help navigate worlds roughest terrain. And dogs can be 100 thousand times more sensitive to odors than humans which can save lives!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: There are 37 species of fox. Why does the fennec look like Yoda? Harbor seals are found washed up on shore - the reason for their injuries will astound you. Plus, the age old question – do sharks really need to swim continuously in order to stay alive?

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: A careless accident that may take mere moments can cause environmental damage that lasts decades, even longer. So what can we do to limit the long term ramifications?

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Gravity determines how much the waves rise and fall during the day. We explore the extroadinary science of tides, how they rise, how they vary, and their effect on the ecosystems of our planet.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: From spectacular rocky coast lines, to natural barrier islands full of wildlife, we're going on an adventure that will thrill your senses. New England and its unique beauty, on Xploration Awesome Planet.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Our rivers and lakes are a major source of water and recreation. This week, we'll explore some of the World's most exciting waterways, from the midwest, to the upper east coast, on Xploration Awesome Planet.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins go under cover as a couple on a romantic bus tour; a love bird on the trip is murdered and evidence is quickly deteriorating in the Hawaiian heat; TC is shaken when he runs into his ex-girlfriend.

programme.title: Magnum
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins take the case of recovering the stolen urn of a woman's deceased husband, but they soon find that others believe the urn is worth killing for; Rick and TC confront a man who's been impersonating football legend Andre Reed.

programme.title: Magnum
programme.desc: As their wedding day approaches, Magnum and Higgins help a modern-day Robin Hood who, thinking she was helping a school obtain needed supplies, unknowingly stole illicit drugs; Rick helps a retired soldier re-enter the workforce as a civilian.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins help Rick when his father figure gets double-crossed; Magnum makes one last bold move to help Higgins stay in the country.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: New clients hire Magnum and Higgins to find their missing brother, which results in Higgins getting shot and TC abducted; Higgins and Magnum are surprised when her surgeon asks her out.

programme.title: Magnum
programme.desc: Higgins' job to repossess a plane goes south when a drug cartel opens fire at the plane, forcing her and Magnum to crash land in the jungle; Higgins has her first date with Dr. Ethan Shah.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: As Magnum, Higgins and TC try to pull one over on a Customs agent to get Higgins a green card, armed gunmen suddenly storm the federal building and start taking hostages.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins help a mixed martial arts fighter who is being pressured by a gang to throw an illegal fight; Kumu is arrested for stealing an artifact from a collector that should be returned to its original resting place.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a college student goes missing just a month before graduation, police immediately suspect foul play. Was it one of the men in her life? Or perhaps a friend who was a little too close? Soon, evidence points to a terrifying new suspect.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: Eric Clark was a loving son, brother and husband. He was a Navy veteran. He stood up for the United States. In order the make extra cash, aside from his regular job, he started up a bartending business. His wife told Eric that Atlanta has great deals in alcohol compared to Alabama, where they lived. One night, Eric made the drive to Atlanta to pick up alcohol for an event he had coming up. Little did Eric know, that would be the last drive he ever made.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: Charles Smith was a bright young man with huge musical aspirations. On one fateful night, all his dreams came to a close when he was found nearly dead at a crossroads in Atlanta. Quinn and Vince hit the streets and begin asking questions of what appears to be a homicide. After digging deeper into the party scene in Atlanta, they soon realize that the killer could be someone they never expected.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: A church reverend follows the sound of gunshots and finds a young woman fighting for her life. Witnesses tell investigators the victim had been involved in a dramatic parking lot brawl earlier that day, had one of the women come back for payback?

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: When a beloved high school football player dies while shielding three girls from bullets in a random shooting, a city comes together to seek justice for a young life lost.

programme.title: Power Players

programme.title: NYC Revealed

programme.title: Poker Masters 2021 Episode 1
programme.desc: The 2021 Poker Masters is underway with Event #1 seeing seven players return and David Peters in control as the chip leader. Peters sits ahead of Brock Wilson, Shannon Shorr, Jonathan Jaffe, Dylan DeStefano, John Riordan, and Ben Yu as they play for the $205,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The game changes to Pot-Limit Omaha at the 2021 Poker Masters with Matthew Wantman holding the lead. Chris Brewer, Jake Daniels, Adam Hendrix, Brent Roberts, and Jake Schindler are all in the mix for the $186,300 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Brekstyn Schutten holds the lead in Event #4 over the final six players as $189,800 awaits the winner. Trailing Schutten are Chad Eveslage, Nick Petrangelo, Sam Soverel, Elio Fox, and Brock Wilson.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The star-studded final table of the $1,500 Stud would see WSOP bracelet winners Men Nguyen, Ted Forrest, and Minh Nguyen looking to add more WSOP gold to their trophy case. Chad Brown would be eyeing his first WSOP bracelet as $111,440 in first-place prize money was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.desc: Lucas shoots a horse thief who turns out to be a member of the Boyle clan. Now Ma Boyle is after him.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When Mark finds gold on their property, a fast-talking salesman who tried to sell Lucas a new lightning rod offers instead to buy the ranch's mineral rights.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas tracks an escaped prisoner to a town that turns out to be run by the gunman's brother who is notorious for shooting people in the back.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When an outlaw leader lures Marshall Torrance out of town, Only Lucas can stop him from lynching a local man who killed one of the members of his gang.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The widow of a bandit killed by Lucas plots a grotesque revenge.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in a man wanted for robbery but loses his reward. A well meaning doctor pays an innocent man to take the blame for his son, but the son sets out to kill the man to make sure he never tells

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in a town for rest just as the local bank has been robbed. A traveling medicine man knows the whereabouts of the suspect and wants Josh to help because he thinks the suspect is innocent.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A widow wants to hire/propose to Josh so she doesn't lose custody of her son. Josh served under her husband in the war. His mother now is trying to steal her grandson to take over the family fortune.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A woman asks Josh, an old friend, to help find her husband Frank - a bounty hunter out to settle a score. He wants to catch a young outlaw who shot him in the leg.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When Randall has a sheriff bed a prisoner, the man's gang kidnaps the sheriff and two others and threatens to kill one per day until the man is freed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: In Mexico, Josh is hired to protect a man and his pregnant wife from his the villagers who are angered when he refuses the town healing woman or "witch" from being present when his wife gives birth.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: After Josh takes the task of finding a man and his wife's pet ewe, he becomes the butt of many jokes while cattlemen nearly hang him when he mentions sheep. His only clue is a gold bell the ewe wore.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When a convicted killer escapes prison, Josh is hired to protect the woman whose testimony put him there. The woman's husband is a lawyer who says he has always been a coward and never carries a gun.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides into a town looking for a man who wants to hire him. When he goes to the man's room at the hotel, Josh is shot. He must figure out who shot him but the sheriff is ordering him out of town.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired by Harry Weaver to track down his twin brother Pete, a wanted man. Harry is tired of being used by Pete, plus the law and bounty hunters are apt to mistake him for Pete.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is called in to track down a new outlaw, the local sheriff who is a friend. The good sheriff who was seduced into robbing a bank by his girlfriend, convinces Josh to let him assist in her capture

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting a deaf teenage girl and keeping everyone off the father's place for a day or two. Although initially bored, Josh starts to develop a relationship with the friendly girl.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh escorts a photographer to take a picture of his friend El Gato, who is a hilarious bandit living in the hills of Mexico with a small army. However, El Gato is new to photographs and leery.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Dan gets injured on the job covering D.J.'s vending machine route, the choice to sue the company could lead to D.J. getting fired.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Ben offers Mark free piano lessons, Darlene finds this as an opportunity to test his parenting skills. Meanwhile, Jackie throws Becky a baby shower.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris confronts Darlene's lifestyle; Jackie meddles in others' affairs to evade her own issues; Becky struggles with the expenses of parenthood, her family lends support.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky applies for a bartending job at Casita Bonita; Dan is concerned it could worsen her drinking.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: At Halloween, Jackie learns a shocking secret while trying to reopen the Lunch Box.

programme.desc: Jackie and Becky pitch their business plan to Darlene in hopes of getting the Lunch Box back, but Darlene's decision leads to hostility among the three.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Thanksgiving chaos erupts as Dan gathers the family; tensions rise over the Lunch Box; Harris surprises everyone with a bold move.

programme.desc: Jackie’s faced with a tough decision that brings the family and community together.

programme.desc: Dan is disappointed when everyone but Becky forgets about his birthday; Darlene faces another issue; Dan excludes Jackie from the family Christmas Santa photo for mistreating Louis

programme.desc: The Conners resist Becky's Packers fan boyfriend; Dan emphasizes family loyalty to the Bears to Mark; Ben and Darlene seek a loan for their magazine.

programme.desc: Darlene’s thrilled when Harris gets into Central Illinois State, but she may have other plans.

programme.desc: The Conners debate voting reasons; Louise's offer threatens to take her from Lanford, prompting family intervention in Dan's relationship.

programme.desc: Dan avoids grief until it confronts him; Ben and Darlene tackle baby fever; Dwight's nervous to fill in for an injured chef.

programme.desc: Dan connects with his half-brother but struggles with their father's unequal treatment; Jackie hits it off with a fun married couple.

programme.desc: Dr. G must decide if she can perform a successful autopsy without the deceased's organs. As she ponders the decision, we are given a rare glimpse into a different side of Dr. G's job.

programme.desc: A mother of infant twins notices that her son is not breathing. EMTs attempt to revive him, but it's too late. Now, Dr. G must work fast to determine if the other twin's life is in danger.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 58-year-old Leroy Williams is rushed to the ER by his wife after becoming disorientated. Doctors work tirelessly, but Leroy slips into a coma and eventually dies.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Keith Douglas is met with a barrage of bullets as he opens his door. The police are looking to Dr. G for hard evidence to link certain suspects to the murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A neighbor hears odd sounds coming from the next apartment. When police arrive, they find a man bruised and dead. When all signs point to foul play, it's up to Dr. G to find proof of murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Paramedics respond to a mother in distress: one of her infant twin girls hasn't woken up. By the time help arrives, it's too late. But there is no apparent cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When an infant dies under mysterious circumstances, the young parents are prime suspects. Dr. G discovers several clues that bolster the child abuse theory, but the case is not clear cut.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Roy Cambells is found dead and covered with scratches, his aggressive 80lb dog by his side. Dr. G wonders if the dog could have been responsible for the man's death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An elderly woman is driving when she's overcome with shooting pains and crashes her car. She's rushed to the hospital, but the doctors find nothing wrong. Can Dr. G find the cause of death?

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A newlywed's hand gets stuck in an appliance and a woman appears to only have blood flow to half of her brain.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman is dragged out of a house fire and has a heart attack in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An ER doctor gets his patient drunk to save his life as a guilty family member looks on.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A young man has a 2-inch pipe through his head. A young bride is bleeding uncontrollably.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man itching from poison oak exposure turns out to also have maggots burrowing into an injury on his back.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman gets stuck in a toilet bowl; a man's leg is mangled by a stump grinder; a nurse collapses.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man who's been smashed by a dumpster barely clings to life. A nun and a prostitute come into the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A mountain biker has multiple injuries and her boyfriend has multiple fainting spells.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A bridesmaid drinks herself into a dangerous coma; a man's eyeball pops out of his head; a premature infant is abandoned in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A hospital worker feels like she's dying but doctors can find nothing wrong.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve, a burn victim receives a rare treatment the doctors have never performed before.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man has a sword impaled in his head in a roleplaying battle, a patient is terrified of germs and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A fishing lure embedded in a man's face turns out to be the least of his problems.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An older patient with prolonged CPR; a stabbing victim on the street; a doctor's dream job becomes a nightmare.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman who inhaled toxic fumes now believes her neighbors want to kill her.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Doctors join their impaled patients for a few rounds of How Did That Get There.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Doctors struggle to save a young man brought to the ER frozen and pulseless.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A deranged cowboy is drenched in sweat, saliva and urine. No one knows why.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: From extraordinary challenges to outrageous predicaments, nurses tell true medical stories from their unique perspectives.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A circus sword-swallower suffers from a persistent case of hiccups; a mother and daughter mysteriously collapse in the ER; a woman loses control of her legs at her daughter's graduation.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A pregnant woman's leg pain turns out to be a flesh-eating virus, threatening life and limb.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A teenage girl is impaled through the neck on an iron fence; a patient is convinced he's turning into a vampire; a first-year attending physician stands up to a room full of senior specialists to save the life of a critically ill pregnant woman.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man arrives in the ER with blue skin, doctors struggle to save a plane crash survivor and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman's thigh is impaled with a piece of rebar. A man brings his girlfriend into the ER for an STD workup.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An ER doctor gets his patient drunk to save his life as a guilty family member looks on.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman's pregnancy veers toward tragedy as eclampsia threatens both her life and that of her child.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An urgent care physician must invent creative ways to save a choking child.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Three emergency deliveries in the ER cause a turf war, gunshot victims have a surprising connection and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A hospital worker feels like she's dying but doctors can find nothing wrong.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Two patients arrive at the ER with bizarre fishing injuries; a martial arts instructor suffers abdominal pains; teenage victims of a car crash fill a small ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A night on the town quickly turns into a fiasco in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A disoriented young woman in a bunny costume checks into the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman gets stuck in a toilet bowl; a man's leg is mangled by a stump grinder; a nurse collapses.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A surgeon requires urgent treatment after falling off a bed while trying to help his patient.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A young nurse collapses in the ER and her co-workers must restart her heart.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman risks losing her finger after trying on an engagement ring, a body builder can't breathe and more.

programme.title: Rabbids
programme.desc: A Rabbid sticks a fake nose on his face, that changes the sound of his voice. The other Rabbids are completely amazed. The leader is jealous and tries to regain his position by using accessories to impress the Rabbids.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Marik's good half possesses Tea again and begs Yugi to destroy him along with his evil side,but he eventually weakens and begins fading away as his dark half loses life points. Yugi and the Pharaoh become hesitant to duel, not wanting to harm the good Marik. As he fades away, Marik appears to an unconscious Odion, thanks him for taking care of him and apologizes, wishing that he could take back his cruel actions. In a cliffhanger, Odion is revealed to have been awakened by Marik's apology.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi continues fending off Marik's attacks, holding out until he has the cards he needs to defeat Marik. Finally, he summons Dark Magician and Dark Magician Girl and uses them to activate Ragnarok – a spell card with the ability to destroy all the monsters on Marik's field, including The Winged Dragon of Ra that he fused himself with.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Odion tries to get the good Marik to resist his evil half. As a result, Yami Marik becomes angered, and attacks Odion with the Millennium Rod, which weakens Odion even more. Odion doesn't give up, despite Ishizu's protests. As Marik continues his onslaught (which begins to injure Odion), Odion tells Marik's good side that together, they had conquered his evil half before, and that they could do it again. Then, he tells the good Marik that since Yami Marik was created by the good Marik's hatred, he has the power to destroy him. As Yami Marik raises the Rod to deliver the final blow, the good Marik disappears from the field, and begins fighting against Yami Marik, who struggles for control over Marik's body, and refuses to be defeated. However, Marik's good half stalls Yami Marik long enough for Yugi to activate his spell card. Yugi's Ragnarok spell succeeds in destroying (and removing to the graveyard) Ra, allowing the good Marik to regain control of his body. However, a sliver of Yami Marik reappears on the field, although this time, he is the victim. Yami Marik tries to convince the good Marik to help him seize the Millennium Items and rule the world together, but fails as Marik has decided to stop being evil and make up for his actions. Marik surrenders the duel to Yugi, which sends Yami Marik to the Shadow Realm, ending the Battle City finals. Bakura and Mai are returned from the shadow realm and Marik is reunited with his siblings, who forgive him. Yugi receives the three Egyptian God Cards. Kaiba then activates the Duel Tower's self-destruct sequence, giving everybody one hour to get off the island before it explodes.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the bank holiday ahead there's plenty of opportunity to catch up with some essential jobs in the garden and Monty gives a masterclass on how to look after and prune soft fruit to ensure maximum production next year. Frances Tophill is at RHS Rosemoor where she is catching up on her vegetable trials which she started earlier in the year, and Alan Power visits Hestercombe Gardens in Somerset to find out more about the discovery of a long lost gladiolus.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the regular team are joined by some new faces offering tips, advice and inspiration from gardens large and small across the country. In this programme Monty is at Longmeadow catching up with some seasonal jobs, and also getting out and about for an inspiring visit to the longest herbaceous border in the world.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is at Longmeadow giving advice on how to deal with unruly roses, taking cuttings of herbs and planting a new tree. Carol Klein continues her series on plant families, exploring some of the most popular relations of the rose and we pay a visit to an orchard in Worcestershire to find out how enthusiasts are caring for one of the rose family members - the plum.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: September is the perfect time for planting and Monty adds some autumn flowering asters to his borders as well as refreshing his strawberry beds with new stock. Carol Klein continues her series on plant families and this week she takes a close look at one of the largest plant families in the world, the daisy family, and we pay a visit to a plant nursery in Hampshire, which specialises in growing plants - including many varieties of daisy - for attracting wildlife.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: There's plenty of advice from Longmeadow this week, as Monty starts to tidy up the garden for autumn and reviews this year's display in the jewel garden. In the final part of Carol Klein's series on plant families she looks at the Apiaceae family, which includes not only stalwart and wild-life friendly plants but also edible roots; and we pay a visit to a giant vegetable grower in Nottinghamshire who is hoping to break the world record with his carrots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty catches up with seasonal jobs at Longmeadow when he divides some perennials and plants alpines for spring colour. He also travels to Dublin to meet Helen Dillon to find out why she is planning to leave her world famous garden after decades of honing it to perfection. In Scotland, Joe Swift begins his quest to find out why we should rekindle our love for rock gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team focus their attention on the loss of wildflower habitats in the UK and the part that gardeners can play in averting the resulting loss of wildlife. Adam Frost is in Lincolnshire to find out how crucial meadows are to supporting an ecosystem.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has advice on how to pot up one of the stars of the festive season: amaryllis. Plus, Carol Klein surrounds herself with colour and scent in Kent as she champions witch hazel, one of winter's most spectacular shrubs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost visits Mary Berry at home to hear about another of her great passions in life, gardening. Mary shares her love of cut flowers and some tips on freezing herbs, while Adam shows her how to sow the tiniest of snapdragon seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips on how to clean garden tools before putting them away for winter, Rachel de Thame marvels at some magical topiary at a garden in Lincolnshire, and Carol Klein embraces the festive spirit with some home-harvested decorations.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings throughout the seasons. While Frances is at Wildside Garden in Devon, Nick Bailey visits a garden in Bedfordshire that blends soft grasses with textural trees and topiary.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for his spring display and tackles slippery paths, Carol Klein visits a collection of Michaelmas daisies and we visit a veg grower with a show-stopping Halloween pumpkin.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Follow along as Mark Peterson travels to Tanzania to hunt the Eastern and Western White-Bearded Wildebeest. These animals are known for their distinctive white beards and large horns, making them a sought-after trophy for hunters on an African safari. Mark sets out on an exciting and thrilling adventure to track down these elusive creatures in the plains of Tanzania.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's 2016 and Mark heads down to Kansas for an early season Muzzleloader Whitetail hunt with Salt River Outfitters. It was hot in the stand with little deer movement until the moon phase switched and one of the bucks Mark had been looking for stepped out. Kansas is one of those states that has an early Muzzleloader season that opens in September, and if you can get the weather and the moon to align you can catch a big deer on his feet in daylight.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson's thrilling adventure in Tanzania continues as he sets his sights on the elusive Grant's Gazelle and the striking Fringe-Eared Oryx. Armed with his precision-engineered Gunwerks Nexus 300 PRC, Mark is poised to make every shot count. The real challenge lies not just in the accuracy of his aim but in getting close enough to these magnificent creatures.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his hunt in Mexico for a Mexican Texanus Whitetail. On day one, Mark connected with a great management buck, making this buck the first Mexican Texanus Whitetail with his rifle. As temperatures drop and bucks become more active each passing day, he eagerly anticipates an action-packed evening ahead.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson and his father Earl have spent six thrilling days immersed in the wilds of Tanzania, exploring the heart of Africa. Next on their adventure, they set out to hunt the elusive Chandler's Mountain Reed buck. However, the raging river poses a formidable challenge, making it too dangerous to cross. Undeterred, they adapt by using alternative means of transportation. Armed with their trusty Gunwerks rifles, they navigate the rugged terrain, determined to get close to these elusive creatures amidst the stunning and challenging landscape.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's 2016 and Mark heads down to Kansas for an early season Muzzleloader Whitetail hunt with Salt River Outfitters. It was hot in the stand with little deer movement until the moon phase switched and one of the bucks Mark had been looking for stepped out. Kansas is one of those states that has an early Muzzleloader season that opens in September, and if you can get the weather and the moon to align you can catch a big deer on his feet in daylight.

programme.title: The Journey Within

The real challenge lies not just in the accuracy of his aim but in getting close enough to these magnificent creatures.

programme.title: The Journey Within

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: No one could suspect that a prestigious golf club would be the setting for murder, but when one of the major members is found dead, bludgeoned to death in a thicket next to the 13th hole, Barnaby and Jones try to determine what made him leave the fairway. It seems the club has a rift between the snobbish members, and local villagers, the latter only allowed onto the course for a few hours a week. Before long, another member turns up dead, and the detectives soon find the club has a hidden history, involving gambling, illegal money lending and assault, prompting the pair to determine if a club member, or one of its staff, is responsible for the deeds.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A newly discovered masterpiece by landscape artist Henry Hogson causes a stir when it is auctioned for £400,000 - just hours before its former owner is tortured and killed. When another Hogson is stolen, Barnaby decides to become an expert on the Midsomer painter, with the help of art teacher Matilda Simms (Susannah Harker). He soon realises the paintings are not what they seem - but the death toll is rising.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Former secret agent Geoffrey Larkin arrives in Midsomer Parva and stays at Allenby House, a country mansion run by former spies Sir Malcolm Frazer (Benjamin Whitrow), his son Nicky (Peter Davison) and Nicky's wife Jenny (Alice Krige) as a safe house. Geoffrey is soon gashed to death after a cricket match in Midsomer Parva, and the locals blame the 'beast of Midsomer'. However, Barnaby - a former spy himself - soon realises that the killing has links to Allenby House and Cold War Berlin, but is initially thrown off the case by MI6. But when a further murder occurs MI6 Agent Glen Jarvis (Neil Stuke) asks Barnaby back on the case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer University science fellow and cycling enthusiast George Jeffers (David Haig) threatens to make public a problem with his state-of-the-art invention Kernel Logic, but American software boss Clinton Finn fears he will lose millions if the truth comes out. When a schoolteacher is killed in a hit-and-run, Barnaby suspects Jeffers was the intended target. The subsequent murder of a fellow cyclist (Philip Jackson) brings the involvement of fellow University associates (Jonathan Cecil and Jim Norton) into sharper focus.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the peaceful village of Little Worthy, Bob Moss was about to open up his beloved model village, when he found a gruesome extra attraction. Young local, Richard Tanner, had been stabbed in the side and his corpse tied down like Gulliver in Lilliput. Barnaby and Jones wonder who wanted him dead, but when the woman he was secretly meeting is killed during the village's Crazy Craft race, the pair have to delve in and discover who might be lying and hiding secrets.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A cat burglar is on the loose, one known as "the Creeper", but the wave of burglaries he or she have committed, seem to have finally led to murder, when David Roper (Rik Mayall) is found smothered in his bed on the Chettham family estate. Yet Barnaby and Jones learn he may have been planning to write a book that could have been quite uncomfortable for someone, leading the pair to determine whether members of the Chettham family, or their friends, were responsible.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A sleep-walking school teacher (Nancy Carroll) starts to believe she has slit the throats of her mentor (Tim Wylton) and a local handyman man in her sleep, but her friends (Paola Dionisotti and Monica Dolan) are not convinced that she is the culprit, nor is Barnaby. A local philanthropist (Paul Chapman) and his social-climbing wife (Suzanne Burden) are planning the annual Frobisher night - but will it go without a hitch, and can they identify the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer is buzzing with excitement at the arrival of the annual ‘Paramount Dance Extravaganza’. But behind the sequins and smiles are deep running feuds and passions.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Prolific real estate agent Alexander Beauvoisin is murdered in front of a crowd at the unveiling of a new dolls house collection at Midsomer Museum of the family.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Deddington’s thriving bee Empire has put Granville Norton on the map, but what lengths will they go to to ensure they’re never dethroned…

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Fishermen and women flock to the village of Solomon Gorge desperate to catch a giant fish that is said to lurk in the lake.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The closing of what was once a very popular public garden in Midsomer Deverell sparks a series of murders that have Inspector Barnaby and Sgt. Troy stumped.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the funeral of local hotelier Karl Wainwright, his hotel's manager and a well liked Punch and Judy performer, Gregory Chambers, disappears unusually in yet another picturesque Midsomer village. Most people dismiss his disappearance completely but when he doesn't turn up, a search is conducted and a severed hand, confirmed to be Gregory's, turns up in the woods. Further deaths and a mushroom poisoning occur surrounding the beneficiaries of Karl Wainwright's will. All is not as it seems.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A man's naked body found under mysterious circumstances, within a crop circle on Sir Harry Chatwyn's wheat field, leads police to investigating how he wound up in the field after being electrocuted. While the nearby village of Midsomer Parva is abuzz with UFO mania, Barnaby is unconvinced by a local ufologist that the man's death was the result of alien activity, as he uncovers rivalries, theft and hatred during his investigations, soon after a well known burglar is found dead in another crop circle with identical injuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Returning home one night, in a drunken state, the local doctor of Newton Magna calls in the police after he had accidentally hit a man, yet when Barnaby and Troy arrive, the injured man is nowhere to be found. As they investigate the mystery, Barnaby encounters an old adversary who is working to help renovate the village and whose daughter is getting married to a local boy. Matters soon become complicated, when the body of the best man's father is found in a well that was being renovated, whom the detectives soon discover had disappeared on the day he was planning to run away with a local farmer's wife.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Dave Cutler, Goodman's Land's amorous postman, is found almost decapitated near the common early one morning. Newspaper girl Holly Reid (Kate Maberly) tells Barnaby that she heard music playing faintly nearby. Barnaby and Troy are aided in their investigations by local WPC Jay Nash (Gillian Kearney).

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the Barnabys prepare for Cully's wedding, Lord Fitzroy and Beth Porteous are married in the pretty village of Bledlow. At the lavish reception at Bledlow Hall that follows, however, tragedy strikes - maid of honour Marina Fellowes is found murdered in one of the rooms by some of the guests. With their honeymoon cancelled, the Fitzroys must contend with a police presence in their home, as Barnaby and Jones try to learn more about the family history. It soon becomes clear there are secrets, deception, and an illegtimate son involved in the mystery, which is further complicated when the estate manager is killed by an arrow.

programme.title: Body Cam Cops
programme.desc: Policing is one of the toughest careers on Earth and sometimes even the most earnest of cops get it wrong. When they do the ramifications are massive. Their actions can taint every officer on the force and change lives for ever. Some crimes are so violent and so personally motivated that every cop involved and person affected will never forget the events. We have access to cops in South Euclid, USA, who chase down a wanted man, corner him in Lake Eerie and bring him down. Only then do they.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Riverside, Jarrod and Barry are greeted by a mob of eager newbies. With their financial futures at stake, the buyers must choose to fight or befriend the crowd. Barry Weiss buys a "mystery trunk." Jarrod and Brandi battle for a unit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Family tensions ping as the buyers head to Ontario, California. Darrell Sheets wants to take son Brandon to the next level of auction buying, and he's willing to do it at Jarrod and Brandi's expense.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene is groomed to vanquish the competition; Ivy learns an important locker lesson; Darrell spends the most money of his career.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave makes his colleagues struggle when they return to his stomping grounds of Santa Ana, Calif.; Jarrod and Brandi are off their game; Ivy crashes the festivities and faces new bidding rivals.

programme.title: Storage Wars

programme.desc: Rene laughs all the way to the bank; Darrell reels in a hoard of goodies.

programme.title: Storage Wars

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Denver Dog discovers that recapturing the past can be more difficult then tracking down felons. On a day of more misses then hits in their fugitive hunting, Dog and Beth repeatedly collide with reminders of their early days.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team get a big surprise after they track down Bosco, a fugitive who they believe is addicted to methamphetamines. They discover he's off drugs, settling into a normal life with a new girlfriend, and is very friendly.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the Chapman clan start their hunt today.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Beth have their hands full when they go after their former housekeeper, Lisa, who's jumped bond. They know this case will be tricky because Lisa knows everyone in the family.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What's a father to do? When the cops ask Dog for help tracking down a renegade teen with a history of running hard, Baby Lyssa, eight months pregnant and counting, insists on joins the hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Darkness has fallen, but with the trail hot and the stakes high Dog and posse refuse to let up. The "Big Fish" in this case is Marco, an alleged drug dealer with a big bond.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When a stripper goes on the lam, Dog has to bring her in--it's a tough job but somebody has to do it. Thankfully for the team, Lady Luck is presiding over the posse tonight.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog doesn't know it yet, but today's bounty is about to take him on a trip down memory lane and test his investigative chops. With each lead propelling him closer and closer to his childhood haunts, Dog uses old-fashioned detective skills.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Fugitive beware: Dog's rolling with extra power today. His old friends Tim Chapman and Sonny Westbrook are riding with the team, so their target, a thief with violent tendencies, is out of luck.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Can Dog complete his mission to clean-up this frontier town? With four outlaws still on the lam, Dog sets out to bring 'em in. As day turns into night and with the darkness and the danger mounting, an undaunted Dog and team plan late night hits.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What's a father to do? When the cops ask Dog for help tracking down a renegade teen with a history of running hard, Baby Lyssa, eight months pregnant and counting, insists on joins the hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.desc: A memo from 1952 surfaces informing President-elect Dwight Eisenhower about the existence of a top-secret group of scientists, government officials and military personnel who are tasked with investigating reports of UFOs.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Researchers ask if Cloud computing represents the rediscovery of an ancient repository of knowledge known as the Akashic Record; neuroscientist Dr. Dario Nardi measures the brainwaves of Dr. Deepak Chopra as he enters a state of deep meditation.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio A. Tsoukalos studies India's Sanskrit texts, which are filled with descriptions of brain surgery, flying crafts, nuclear physics, and other advanced sciences; Hindu scholars attribute this knowledge to a time when gods walked among humans.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists suggest that some extraterrestrials may closely resemble animals, as evidenced by gods depicted with animal traits; researchers suggest that some animals may have been planted here by aliens as part of an experiment to shape life on Earth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Throughout the ancient world, structures were built to mirror the constellations in the night sky and this is only apparent when they are viewed from high above; a look at the possibility that these structures were designed as messages.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A mysterious mountain in northern Italy has stood witness to strange sightings in the sky and unexplainable phenomena for hundreds of years but could it be attracting extraterrestrial visitors and there could be technology within its rocky slopes.

programme.desc: Examining some of the thousands of potentially habitable exoplanets discovered over the past 20 years and whether some of them could be home to intelligent extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1980, the FBI began a massive undercover operation, code named Safebet, that was designed to expose the Chicago Mafia's infiltration into the city's surrounding suburbs. Undercover agents quickly discovered that the mob had its tentacles spread into every facet of the law enforcement community. They unwittingly uncovered the murder of a wealthy socialite perpetrated by a jealous and greedy mob lawyer and covered up by the local police chief.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1988, a wealthy Jackson, Mississippi woman disappeared from her home in broad daylight. Left behind was a mysterious ransom note listing twelve names and no specific instructions. The note, and a few drops of blood were the only clues to her fate. FBI and local police struggled to find answers in the cryptic message so they could find the kidnapper and retrieve the victim before her time ran out. Solving the crime required the keen insight of a criminal profiler and the perseverance of a family, local authorities, and the FBI.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On June 21, 1964, three civil rights workers, two white and one black disappeared in Mississippi while passing through Neshoba County. A massive FBI investigation led to the recovery of the bodies of the slain men and physical evidence was recovered and analyzed. The FBI labs confirmed that all but one of the bullets used to kill the men came from the same gun. The FBI gained the trust of an informant, whose information led to the conviction of seven local Ku Klux Klan members.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On August 20, 1980, an unseen sniper murdered two young black men as they jogged with two white women in Salt Lake City, Utah. Police threw all their resources into finding a killer who left almost no clues behind. They met with FBI agents and detectives from around the country who had similar racially motivated sniper slayings. A month later, working off little more than a possible license plate number, police in Kentucky arrested Joseph Paul Franklin but the man escaped from custody.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At first it seemed like a tragic hunting accident when 18-year-old David Wilkey was shot to death in rural Virginia in 1983. A tenacious insurance investigator suspected foul play, but he had no direct evidence. Two years later a man contacted North Carolina FBI agents with a complex story of conspiracy and murder-for-hire: he claimed he had been hired to murder Wilkey's killer.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: California Highway Patrolman George Gwaltney discovered the body of 23-year-old Robin Bishop near her car on a remote desert highway. Although he proclaimed his innocence the FBI lab experts were able to link tool marks found on the frame with tools found in Gwaltney's home. Through the match of hairs and fibers and a unique test for detecting and identifying sperm, Gwaltney was placed at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When five-year-old Melissa Brannen disappeared from a Christmas party in December 1989, the only probable suspect was 24-year-old Caleb Hughes. Hughes reportedly left the party around the time Melissa vanished, but no one saw him with the girl. Fifty blue acrylic fibers collected during a search of Hughes' car, however, became the major piece of evidence in the case. FBI fiber analysis determined that those fibers were identical to the ones that made up the sweater Melissa was wearing.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1984, south Miami became the home for a sadistic serial killer. Posing as a fashion photographer, Christopher Wilder lured young women from shopping malls with promises of fame and fortune. Most ended up dead. As the FBI closed in around him, Wilder took off on a cross-country murderous rampage. The FBI added Wilder to their Most Wanted Fugitives program. The chase was on, and Wilder ultimately lost.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By April of 1995 in Washington, D.C., two officers had been shot and one had been murdered. Each had been sitting in their patrol cars when a man sneaked up and opened fire. The FBI was brought in to help catch the cop killer. Agents identified the man who was most likely the killer, but he was nowhere to be found. Months of surveillance operations around the country finally yielded a break; they found their suspect in Baltimore, MD.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In rural Texas, 13-year-old is kidnapped on her way to school. Frantic to find her safely, her millionaire father calls local authorities and the FBI. As police officers and agents conduct aerial surveillance, the father drives hundreds of miles through the night to deliver the ransom cash to a drop that the kidnappers keep changing. In a final effort to save the young girl, investigators must engage in a dangerous firefight with five desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, FBI agents began investigating New York gas station mogul Gurmeet Dhinsa for gas pump rigging. They soon realized that Dhinsa was more than a crooked businessman, he enforced his mob-like operation with brutal violence, kidnapping and killing errant employees and any family members who questioned their deaths. FBI agents worked their way into Dhinsa's violent world.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1986, a small crime free Indiana town was turned inside out by the arrival of one dangerous stranger. After an officer was gunned down at point-blank range, the psychotic killer led investigators across the Midwest. No one knew where the gunman would strike next, even as his tally of murders and abductions grew. The FBI and state police raced against time to rescue America's heartland from this deranged gunman, before he killed again.

programme.title: Los archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El 21 de junio de 1964, tres defensores de los derechos civiles, uno blanco y uno negro, desaparecieron de Mississippi mientras cruzaban el condado de Neshoba. Una investigación del FBI a gran escala llevó a la recuperación de los cuerpos de los hombres asesinados y la evidencia física fue recuperada y analizada. Los laboratorios del FBI confirmaron que todas excepto una de las balas usadas para asesinar a los hombres provenían de la misma arma. El FBI se ganó la confianza de un informante, cuya información condujo a la condena de siete miembros del Ku Klux Klan local.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in summer of 1990, the bodies of several women began turning up in and around the city of Vienna, Austria. From an extensive investigation by the Viennese police, it was determined that these murders were the work of one sadistic predator. Europe was dealing with a serial killer. With no experience with this kind of predator, Viennese police turned to the FBI. FBI profilers were able to identify a suspect in the murders. More ominously, they linked this same killer to murders committed in the United States.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Memphis, Tennessee, a horrible crime terrified local residents. When a wealthy young mother was abducted in front of her in-laws' home, the police had no shortage of suspects. The twenty-five year old victim left behind a tumultuous marriage, an ex-husband, and several spurned boyfriends. All were on the FBI's short list. To find the woman and her abductor, investigators would have to first determine the motive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On Mississippi's Gulf Coast, a judge and his politician wife were brutally murdered in their home. The killer left few clues and the investigation led nowhere. But the FBI was patiently waiting in the wings. Once it was determined that federal laws had been violated, they pounced on the investigation. They uncovered a corrupt local government and a group of violent criminal conspirators known as the Dixie Mafia, responsible for fraud, money laundering and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Kokomo, Indiana an unthinkable crime terrified residents. A young woman was snatched from her home on a bright spring morning. Drops of blood and a torn window screen were all that was left to tell authorities what happened to the twenty-one year old victim. After several days of searching, a former FBI profiler narrowed the suspect list to one. Agents and detectives followed the trail across state lines hoping to find the victim before her time ran out.

programme.title: Los archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El 21 de junio de 1964, tres defensores de los derechos civiles, uno blanco y uno negro, desaparecieron de Mississippi mientras cruzaban el condado de Neshoba. Una investigación del FBI a gran escala llevó a la recuperación de los cuerpos de los hombres asesinados y la evidencia física fue recuperada y analizada. Los laboratorios del FBI confirmaron que todas excepto una de las balas usadas para asesinar a los hombres provenían de la misma arma. El FBI se ganó la confianza de un informante, cuya información condujo a la condena de siete miembros del Ku Klux Klan local.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On August 20, 1980, an unseen sniper murdered two young black men as they jogged with two white women in Salt Lake City, Utah. Police threw all their resources into finding a killer who left almost no clues behind. They met with FBI agents and detectives from around the country who had similar racially motivated sniper slayings. A month later, working off little more than a possible license plate number, police in Kentucky arrested Joseph Paul Franklin but the man escaped from custody.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Residents of the small town of Noel, Missouri were shocked when one of their banks was robbed. When the bank president was nowhere to be found, the residents were outraged. The FBI discovered that things are not always as they appear. Minute clues led the agents to the body of the bank president. With no suspects, the FBI relied on dogged determination and modern forensics. Agents slowly pieced together tiny shreds of evidence.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a young boy and his mother were kidnapped and murdered by a vicious drug cartel, FBI agents in the field worked tirelessly to pierce the secretive drug underworld and unearth those involved. Their surveillance and investigative work uncovered a violent trail of murder and greed. FBI agents and forensic examiners pieced together the evidence needed to draw out and then crush the cartel.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 26, 1993, an explosion rocked the World Trade Center parking garage. Six people died and more than a thousand were injured in the bomb blast that tore a 5-story crater in the building. During the investigation, the twisted fender of a rental van was extracted from the rubble. The FBI was able to determine from where the van was rented and by whom. Undercover agents then made their arrests within six days of the bombing.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 80's, Florida's cocaine imports were among the highest in the nation. Regional territories were enforced with intimidation and murder. Desperate to stop the violence, local authorities turned to the FBI for help. One dealer bowed to no one. He would stop at nothing to keep detectives and agents from building a case against him. When his organization began targeting the government itself, a city went on high alert.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By April of 1995 in Washington, D.C., two officers had been shot and one had been murdered. Each had been sitting in their patrol cars when a man sneaked up and opened fire. The FBI was brought in to help catch the cop killer. Agents identified the man who was most likely the killer, but he was nowhere to be found. Months of surveillance operations around the country finally yielded a break; they found their suspect in Baltimore, MD.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: California Highway Patrolman George Gwaltney discovered the body of 23-year-old Robin Bishop near her car on a remote desert highway. Although he proclaimed his innocence the FBI lab experts were able to link tool marks found on the frame with tools found in Gwaltney's home. Through the match of hairs and fibers and a unique test for detecting and identifying sperm, Gwaltney was placed at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On June 21, 1964, three civil rights workers, two white and one black disappeared in Mississippi while passing through Neshoba County. A massive FBI investigation led to the recovery of the bodies of the slain men and physical evidence was recovered and analyzed. The FBI labs confirmed that all but one of the bullets used to kill the men came from the same gun. The FBI gained the trust of an informant, whose information led to the conviction of seven local Ku Klux Klan members.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 90s, Washington, D.C. police were losing the battle against street gangs who enforced their territories with lethal violence. The homicide rate in the nation's capital climbed to the highest in the country. Local police turned to the FBI for help, but agents soon found themselves in the direct line of fire. In the fall of 1994, a gang member walked into police headquarters, killed two FBI agents and one detective, then turned the gun on himself.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June of 1992, masked bandits pulled off a daring mid-day bank robbery. It marked the beginning of a four-year crime wave that rocked Seattle. With each new robbery, the bandits perfected their craft, leaving behind no evidence and escaping with hundreds and thousands of dollars. As the robbers became increasingly violent, pressure mounted to end their reign. With few leads, the FBI forced their own luck. The effort put them face to face with an armed and desperate fugitive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In July 1997, a triple murder terrified residents in the nation's capital. In a Georgetown coffee shop, three employees were shot to death. Investigators could find no immediate suspects and no clear motive for the attack. Evidence at the crime scene pointed in many different directions. Was this a hate crime, a robbery gone wrong, or an act of cold-blooded vengeance against one of the victims?

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A young mother and her infant son mysteriously disappeared from their home. The woman's husband was the only suspect, but he was eventually cleared. There was no solid evidence that a crime had even been committed. Six months later, a local farmer found the remains of the missing woman and her child. Both had been murdered. Agents and local police had only one tiny piece of evidence, an unidentified hair found in the murdered woman's car. The hair was too small for analysis.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A 1981 armored car robbery near New York City left one guard dead and another critically wounded. Police stopped suspects nearby and another shoot-out ensued, claiming the lives of two officers. Local police and the FBI suspected a large group of domestic terrorists with a history of violent crime. They would try to ferret out these heavily armed criminals who moved in a shadowy underworld and were not afraid to kill authorities.

programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of a pregnant woman leads to a former professional football player and several women associated with him.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: The security cameras at the home of a wife and mother of three's home may hold the key to solving the mystery of her disappearance.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: When the death of a 59-year-old father is found to be unrelated to his ongoing health issues, police begin an investigation and question some of his family members.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: A teen driver discusses what happened the night she was involved in a car crash that left a pregnant woman and her son dead; authorities try to determine if the incident was an accident or intentional.

programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of a pregnant woman leads to a former professional football player and several women associated with him.
